image.altText: An onshore gas facility, as viewed from across the harbour.

props.synopsis: An oil spill that leaked into Darwin Harbour and the substantial under-reporting of toxic emissions have put one of Australia's biggest gas companies under federal investigation.

title.children: Oil spill, emissions error trigger gas giant federal investigation

image.altText: Tall buildings seen from a few kilometres away over leafy suburbs and water

props.synopsis: People across the Northern Territory's Top End woke to shaking in the early hours during a magnitude-6.4 earthquake in the Banda Sea near Timor-Leste.

title.children: Top End wakes to shaking from magnitude-6.4 earthquake in Banda Sea

image.altText: CDP participant at Crowhurst

props.synopsis: Three Aboriginal Northern Territory councils say they will cancel leases critical to the rollout of the federal government's new jobs program after they claim they were overlooked for funding because they were "not Aboriginal enough".

title.children: 'The final straw': Remote councils threaten to disrupt $2.6b remote jobs program

image.altText: A tanned Aboriginal woman walking with a white man with a beard, she's wearing blue blazer, white top, brown hair.

props.synopsis: Jacinta Nampijinpa Price has been accused of "using her position" to "promote" her defamation of Central Land Council CEO Lesley Turner, on the final day of the Federal Court civil defamation trial.

title.children: Senator accused of 'using her position' to defame land council boss

image.altText: A montage of images including the back of a person and two newspaper clippings, one with a headline about "fondle claims".

props.synopsis: Victims of a paedophile who used children's artwork to hide abuse are suing the Victorian Education Department, alleging his abuse should have been stopped earlier.

title.children: Victims say paedophile teacher groomed them to believe students were his 'wives'

image.altText: A wide shot of a brick building, tin roof, with front sign reading 'Holy Spirit Church, slightly obstructed by green bushes

props.synopsis: Police charge a 38-year-old man who allegedly stabbed a Darwin priest in the face with a pen while he was setting up for evening mass.

title.children: Man charged after Darwin priest stabbed in face with pen while setting up for mass

image.altText: A person's hands are illuminated by the pale glow of a computer screen, as they type in a dark room.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government has moved to restrict Freedom of Information request laws which, if passed, would block an environment group's long-running attempt to seek historic documents.

title.children: NT bill attempts to shield backbenchers from Freedom of Information laws

image.altText: A man photographed  from behind, watching horse racing on pub TV screens.

props.synopsis: Three weeks after an ABC investigation raised allegations against the NT's gambling commission, the government is refusing to answer straightforward questions about what's being done – if anything.

title.children: Five questions the NT government won't answer after Four Corners investigation

image.altText: A false-colour satellite image, showing the centre of a hurricane in red and large swirling storms extending from it.

props.synopsis: The World Meteorological Organization says the Caribbean island nation faces a "catastrophic situation" in the coming hours.

title.children: Hurricane Melissa brings widespread devastation to Jamaica, tracks for Cuba

image.altText: Yasmine Phillips and Chris Robinson with daughters Sage (centre) and Ava.

props.synopsis: A program introduced in Australia in 2018 has led to thousands of fewer babies born early each year, according to a new study.

title.children: A study of 2 million Australian births led doctors to world-first discovery

image.altText: A hand holding a phone with the BOM website

props.synopsis: Environment Minister Murray Watt tells the Bureau of Meteorology that its new $4.1 million website needs to be fixed after complaints from users.

title.children: Bureau of Meteorology ordered to fix new website after torrent of complaints

image.altText: The Malaysian prime minister sitting in a chair smiling.

props.synopsis: The South-East Asian nation has been in the spotlight this week after hosting the ASEAN summit, which was attended by Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and US President Donald Trump.

title.children: 'Things have changed': Malaysia's PM on navigating Trump's tariffs

image.altText: A woman wearing a suit smiles and waves.

props.synopsis: Former US vice-president Kamala Harris reveals she is contemplating another run for the presidency and says she was "reckless" to not stop Joe Biden from pursuing a second term.

title.children: 'Knew what he would do': Harris speaks out on Trump's America

image.altText: A grainy, monochrome image of two boats close together on the ocean.

props.synopsis: Mexican authorities are searching for a lone survivor seen clinging to wreckage following the strikes in the eastern Pacific Ocean.

title.children: 14 people killed as US destroys four more alleged drug boats

image.altText: Man looking sad at doorway

props.synopsis: More than 100 residents face an uncertain future after a Queensland council votes to end permanent residencies at a holiday park.

title.children: Dozens of homes now 'worthless' after council's van park decision

image.altText: Ley walks through a corridor, surrounded by cameras and reporters.

props.synopsis: The opposition leader is standing by her call for Anthony Albanese to apologise for wearing a Joy Division T-shirt, despite some within her own party distancing themselves from the remarks. Follow Live.

title.children: Ley stands by call for PM to apologise for Joy Division shirt

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: BOM 'moving quickly' to act on feedback after new site sparks backlash
O'Brien declines to support Ley's call for PM to apologise for Joy Division shirt
Ley stands by call for PM to apologise for Joy Division shirt

image.altText: A middle aged white man with white hair looking in the mirror, folding his lips back to reveal broken teeth

props.synopsis: A 12-fold increase in Australians raiding their retirement nest eggs to fund expensive dental treatments in recent years has been labelled a "systemic failure".

title.children: Jon has been left with metal posts instead of teeth and $40k less super

image.altText: A sketch of a man with grey hair and glasses in a grey jacket, white collared shirt and dark tie.

props.synopsis: Prosecutors in Melbourne's Easey Street murder case tell a court that DNA found at the crime scene is highly likely to have come from prime suspect Perry Kouroumblis.

title.children: DNA from 1977 murder scene likely came from prime suspect, court hears

image.altText: Sam Kerr rubs her forehead with her left hand in frustration

props.synopsis: Sam Kerr's coach and teammates aren't second-guessing the decision to re-install her as Matildas captain after returning to the field following a lengthy lay-off.

title.children: Matildas launch fierce defence of Sam Kerr amid criticism of captaincy call

image.altText: John Cleese at a kitchen bench next to Prunella Scales during a scene in Fawlty Towers.

props.synopsis: Prunella Scales has been remembered as part of the golden era of British comedy for her numerous roles across film, TV and theatre.

title.children: John Cleese leads tributes to 'perfect' on-screen wife Prunella Scales

image.altText: Illustration of car and home with rooftop solar.

props.synopsis: Plug-in hybrid electric vehicles are sweeping the Australian market. Exclusive modelling suggests the "low-emission" sales boom may actually delay emissions reductions.

title.children: Users say they plug in their hybrid EVs, but the data says otherwise

image.altText: A red children's truck sits in front of some other toys on a floor.

props.synopsis: A Four Corners investigation reveals there are more childcare workers convicted or accused of sexual assault than the public has previously understood, including in the ACT.

title.children: No clear process for revealing abuse allegations at childcare centres

image.altText: White cruise ship on water with island in background.

props.synopsis: The Australian Maritime Safety Authority will speak with the crew of a cruise ship that allegedly left behind an 80-year-old Australian woman, who was later found dead on a Queensland tropical island.

title.children: 'Knew she was dead': Tourists distressed after cruise passenger's body found

image.altText: Mark Latham wearing a suit speaking to media on the street outside court.

props.synopsis: An apprehended violence order application against MP Mark Latham is "very much likely" to be resolved but remains ongoing, his former partner's lawyer has told a court.

title.children: 'Likely to settle': Update in AVO matter filed by Latham's ex-partner

image.altText: Benjamin Netanyahu looking stern at a press conference.

props.synopsis: Gaza health officials say the Israeli strikes have killed at least 26 people, including four in Gaza City's Sabra neighbourhood and five in a car in Khan Younis.

title.children: Israel hits Gaza in 'powerful' strikes but US says ceasefire holding

image.altText: People gathered around the LEGO City.

props.synopsis: An 80 per cent dropout rate, compliance concerns, and a LEGO city sold as a "highlight" — this multimillion-dollar cybersecurity initiative has been labelled a "patch job".

title.children: 'A show pony': New cybersecurity course had 80pc dropout rate

image.altText: Libs Axing composite

props.synopsis: Former party leader Elizabeth Lee and backbencher Peter Cain have been suspended indefinitely from the Canberra Liberals party room.

title.children: Liberal party room indefinitely suspends former leader, backbencher

image.altText: A regal sandstone court building beneath a clear sky.

props.synopsis: A NSW childcare worker has pleaded guilty to recklessly wounding the boy, who sustained a 2cm laceration when she tried to put him down for a rest.

title.children: Childcare worker admits injuring 4yo who had to have head wound glued

image.altText: Man in a hat holds a toddler, both are smiling

props.synopsis: Half the workforce at the Tahmoor Colliery in NSW has been stood down without pay, with workers and their families facing weeks of financial uncertainty.

title.children: Future uncertain for workers stood down from mothballed coal mine

image.altText: Batter walking off after being dismissed, head bowed, bowler celebrating with a hand gesture to teammates

props.synopsis: NSW opener Sam Konstas's bid to open the batting for Australia in the first Ashes Test has taken another hit, after the 20-year-old was dismissed early on day two of the Sheffield Shield match against Queensland.

title.children: Konstas bowled cheaply after leaving a ball that hit middle stump

image.altText: An orange mesh bag full of oyster shells.

props.synopsis: A marine ecologist's discovery two years ago sparked a restoration project and has become a key element in South Australia's response to a devastating algal bloom.

title.children: The key role a 'lost' reef is playing in SA's algal bloom fight

image.altText: An aerial shot of a small archipelago of islands surrounded by water.

props.synopsis: One the Pacific's most high-profile leaders is pressing Anthony Albanese to fly to the global UN climate summit in Brazil next month to "close the deal" with Türkiye and secure COP31 hosting rights for next year.

title.children: 'Crunch time': Palau president wants Albanese to go to Brazil to secure COP31

image.altText: Three older people sit in a boat in flooded water.

props.synopsis: Heavy rains cause major flooding in central Vietnam, while a category five hurricane rages on the other side of the world in the Caribbean.

title.children: Vietnam tourist hotspots flooded after record rainfall

image.altText: An armed soldier and hospital workers unload bodies at a hospital while a crowd looks on

props.synopsis: More than 60 people have been killed in Rio de Janeiro's deadliest police operation, staged in the lead-up to the city hosting COP30 summit events.

title.children: More than 60 people killed in Rio police operation targeting cartels
